title: Definition of Real Numbers
text: A number is real if it is rational or irrational.
speech: A number is real if it is rational or irrational.
pacedSpeech: A number is real if it is rational or irrational.

title: Definition of a Rational Number
text: A rational number is one that either stops or repeats a decimal pattern forever. For example, $$4$$, 4,43, and $$4.3$$, where the $$3$$ repeats forever, are rational numbers.
speech: A rational number is one that either stops or repeats a decimal pattern forever. For example, , 4 , 4,43, and  4.3 , where the  3  repeats forever, are rational numbers.
pacedSpeech: A rational number is one that either stops or repeats a decimal pattern forever. For example,  , 4

title: Definition of an Irrational Number
text: An irrational number is one that does not stop or repeat a decimal pattern forever. An example of an irrational number is $$"2.01001000100001..."$$
speech: An irrational number is one that does not stop or repeat a decimal pattern forever. An example of an irrational number is  quotation mark 2.01001000100001 dot dot dot quotation mark
pacedSpeech: An irrational number is one that does not stop or repeat a decimal pattern forever. An example of an irrational number is   quotation mark 2.01001000100001 dot dot dot quotation mark

title: Value of $$\sqrt{64}$$
speech: , the square root of 64 is equal to 8
pacedSpeech: , the square root of 64 is equal to 8
